questions.question: What was the Bureau of Indian Affairs?

choices.answer: An office to protect the ways of Amer Indians
A fed govt office established for policies for Amer Indians
An agency for Creek and Chickasaw Indians
A group established by the MS legislature to track Indians

questions.question: What was most significant about the Choctaw Indians after 1830?

choices.answer: They were the 1st Amer Indians removed to Indian Territory
Their govt was the 1st to be abolished by and American state
Their example inspired other Amer Indians to settle
They were 1st Amer Indians to be raided by settlers
east of Mississippi River
south of the Blue Ridge Mountains
most of present-day Oklahoma
most of present-day Arkansas

questions.question: Who benefited most from Andrew Jackson's plan to remove American Indians to the West?

choices.answer: Amer Indians, who gained protection by the US government
Pres Jackson, who gained public approval
Amer farmers, who gained millions of acres of land
Cherokee Indians, who gained a new model of government

questions.question: How did the Cherokee people resist removal to Indian Territory?

choices.answer: They looked for protection and work in white communities
They traded tribal good for knives, gun, & other weapons
They brought a case against the state to a federal court.
They published a newspaper directed toward federal officials

questions.question: What did the Supreme  Court rule in Worcester v Georgia?

choices.answer: The Cherokee Indians had to move from their land in Georgia.
The state of GA had no legal power over the Cherokee.
Only state govt had authority over American Indians.
US troops in any state had the right to move Amer Indians

questions.question: Who made this statement? "John Marshall has made his decision: now let him enforce it."

choices.answer: John Calhoun
James McCulloch
Andrew Jackson
Sequoya

questions.question: Which statement describes "The Trail of Tears?"

choices.answer: the streams of blood that flowed from the Sauk Indians
the involuntary 800 mile march Cherokee Indians made
the line connecting Seminole Indian settlements
the traces of salt reportedly seen on Osceola's face

questions.question: Which word best describes Andrew Jackson's treatment of American Indians?

choices.answer: sympathetic
legal
strange
brutal

questions.question: Which one of these American Indian groups resisted removal with force?

choices.answer: Cherokee
Sauk
Creek
Chickasaw
